meanings.definition: A person under the authority or control of another.
meanings.sent1: The manager's subordinates followed his instructions diligently.
meanings.sent2: In the military, soldiers are considered subordinates to their commanding officers.
meanings.sent3: The subordinates in the office threw a surprise party for their boss.
meanings.sent4: The subordinates of the queen worked tirelessly to ensure the kingdom's prosperity.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's subordinates, the students, eagerly listened to her every word.

meanings.definition: To treat or regard as of lesser importance or rank.
meanings.sent1: It is not right to constantly subordinate your colleagues in team projects.
meanings.sent2: Some managers tend to subordinate the opinions of their team members.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly subordinates his cat's preferences when choosing TV shows to watch.
meanings.sent4: Don't subordinate your health for the sake of work.
meanings.sent5: She always subordinates her own needs to help others in need.

meanings.definition: To make subservient or subject to the authority or control of another.
meanings.sent1: The dictator sought to subordinate the entire population to his rule.
meanings.sent2: The evil sorcerer used dark magic to subordinate the villagers to his will.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous fairy tried to subordinate the forest animals to her commands.
meanings.sent4: The villain's plan was to subordinate the hero and take over the city.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotist's goal was to subordinate the audience's thoughts during the show.
